Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Communication Studies
Requirements: To apply for admission to Kutztown University as a first-year student, you must submit the following items: a completed application for admission (either the KU application or the Common Application), your official high school transcript, and a $35 application fee or fee waiver. Submission of SAT or ACT scores, an essay/personal statement, and letters of recommendation are optional.

The Communication Studies minor is an 18-credit program. Required courses include COM 110, COM 220, and either COM 230 or COM 240. Students must also complete nine credits of electives chosen from a specified list of COM courses. A minor must include 18 credits, with 9 credits at the 200 level or higher. No more than 6 credits may be used to satisfy requirements for both a major and a minor.

In addition to your transcript, you are welcome to submit the following optional materials to be reviewed: Official SAT or ACT scores; Essay/personal statement; Letters of recommendation.
Minors and certificates can be declared by using the online "Change of Major" form, which is found in the student's MyKU account.
